pages.text: Research Interest Developing computational methods for understanding, modeling and predicting microbiomes and microbial interactomes. Distilling critical information from molecular biological data and embedding it in the higher-level process or system models for more explanatory and predictive power. Exploring the practicality of machine learning approach for large scale microbiome analysis and complex life system engineering. Research Experiences 2010-present, Graduate research assistant@Institute for Environmental Genomics Developing the technology and analysis pipeline of GeoChip 4.x and 5.0, and HuMiChip 2.0 and 3.0. Developing Ecological Function Oriented Metagenomic Analysis Pipeline (EcoFun-MAP) for deep shotgun metagenomics sequencing data analysis. Developing Molecular Ecological Network inference and analysis pipeline. Developing Random Matrix Theory based de novo methods for characterizing microbial interactive networks. Data processing, statistical analysis, math modeling and method development for 20+ funded research projects, including the in-house and collaborative. 2008-2009, Intern software developer@Organization Department of Yunnan province, China Developing information system for Yunnan provincial government human resource management. 2008-2010, Undergraduate research assistant@Yunnan University, China No-regret learning for cost constrained resource selection game. A Java based graphic system for simulating Percolation phenomenon. Profile Summary Specializing in the field of bioinformatics, computational biology, data analytics, multi-omics and microbial ecology. Adept in computational method development and data analytics, and delivered extensive analyses for multi-million data intense projects funded by both U.S. government agencies and private foundations. Experienced in independently addressing computational needs and solving problems from diverse scientific backgrounds as a bioinformatics software developer, while collaborating with domestic and oversea researchers. Education 2010-present, Ph.D. Candidate of Microbiology (Computational), University of Oklahoma 2006-2010, Bachelor of Software Engineering, Yunnan University, China Achievement Highlights Co-authored 14 publications with 200+ citations (Google Scholar) on impactful professional journals, including top journals such as the Nature Climate Change, Nature Communication and Ecology Letters, among which one study was highlighted by the Washington Post. There are 8 more publications that are in preparation. Being major and active developer for the GeoChip technology, which was a winner for the R&D 100 Award. Won 3 times ASM (international) Student Travel Grant Award, 2 times Institute for Environmental Genomics Performance Award, 1 time ASM Outstanding Student Poster Award and George L. and Cleo Cross Graduate Student Endowed Scholarship Award.
